name: Physical health
description: The state of being physically fit and healthy, free from illness or injury. It is the overall physical condition of an individual, including physical strength, endurance, and flexibility.

name: Mental health
description: The psychological well-being of an individual, including the ability to cope with stress, manage emotions, and make positive decisions.

name: Education
description: The process of acquiring knowledge, skills, and values through formal study, instruction, and experience.

name: Food security
description: The availability of adequate, safe, and nutritious food to meet the dietary needs of individuals and their families.

name: Equal rights
description: The right of all individuals to be treated equally and without discrimination, regardless of their race, gender, religion, or other characteristics.

name: Access to clean water
description: The availability of clean, safe, and potable water for drinking, cooking, and other uses.

name: Environmental sustainability
description: The ability of the environment to sustain its natural resources and support the needs of current and future generations.

name: Lack of poverty
description: The absence of extreme poverty, in which individuals and families have access to basic needs such as food, shelter, and healthcare.

name: Gender equality
description: The equal rights and opportunities of all individuals, regardless of gender.

name: Economic stability
description: The ability of an economy to maintain a consistent level of growth and development over time.

name: Access to energy
description: The availability of energy sources such as electricity, gas, and oil to meet the needs of individuals and businesses.

name: Security
description: The protection of individuals, property, and information from harm or theft.

name: Job opportunities
description: The availability of employment opportunities that provide individuals with the means to support themselves and their families.

name: Political stability
description: The ability of a government to maintain a consistent level of political order and stability over time.

name: Good governance
description: The effective management of a countryâ€™s resources and institutions in a way that is transparent, accountable, and responsive to the needs of its citizens.

name: Financial inclusion
description: The ability of individuals and businesses to access and use financial services, such as banking, credit, and insurance.

name: Quality housing
description: The availability of safe, secure, and affordable housing for individuals and families.

name: Social protection
description: The provision of social services and benefits to individuals and families in need.

name: Reduced inequality
description: The reduction of disparities in income, wealth, and access to resources between different groups of people.

name: Haven from violence
description: The availability of safe and secure environments in which individuals and families can live without fear of violence or harm.
